CatDescriptText: Dr. G.S. Braun, chiropodist, of the Empire Building and Mrs. Lester Biederman, housewife, Mount Lebanon were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 30, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Are you in favor of increasing the city wage tax to pay salaries for additional police officers in Pittsburgh?  Say, about 500 more?"  Dr. Braun's answer reads: " We need additional policemen, but I believe that the wage tax is not necessary.  I believe that the salaries could be paid from other sources." Mrs. Biederman's answer reads: " I would be interested if the police do their duty the way they are supposed to do, according to the oath they have taken..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Dr. G.S. Braun wearing light colored fedora with dark band and dark overcoat, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Mrs. Lester Biederman wearing light colored hat and dark grid patterned coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade. Liberty Avenue, Downtown
